ratings.comment: Professor David Hogg is a GREAT lecturer, he loves entomology and he cares about his students. He even learned the names of students, even though Entomology 201 is a large class!
Prof Hogg is a good lecturer who is really passionate about the topic! The class in interesting and not really hard so for sure take it if  you need to fulfill your biological sciences requirement!
He's super nice, and the class is super easy! Almost made me change majors. Bug's Rule!

Professor Hogg is a very clear lecturer and really loves bugs.  He gives out weekly quizzes that always have extra credit on them and the 3 midterms have about 5 ex credit points each.  There is a bug project where you get to raise a Manduca Hornworm and an easy paper as well.  Liked the class a lot and attending is recommended but not needed.
Totally awesome professor! Great lectures and easy tests and quizzes. You get to raise a manduca (the project is great!). Must take!

He is one of the best professors I have had. There are weekly quizzes but are fairly easy if you look through his powerpoints. All the quiz questions show up on exams and he offers a ton of bonus points. Raising a bug was fun and you have to keep a daily journal which isn't hard to do. There is one paper but that is graded fairly easy.

He was very clear about grading and what needed to be done to get an A. Lectures were relatively enjoyable and students get to raise their own bugs. The only negative about the class is that there is a lot of busy work (journals about the bugs). I wouldn't bother buying the textbook. There was one question from it all semester.

Cutest old man ever, really cares about his students and if you ever are unclear about something or concerned he is more than willing to help you out. Despite contrary belief I actually had to study for the tests and quizzes but got A's

Hilarious and definitely in my top 3 professors at UW. Class was easy to get an A, and lectures were really interesting. Raising Manduca sexta was a highlight. The only downside was a paper, which was graded easily, but still a pain if you hate writing them.
OMG, LOVE HIM!

Professor Hogg is not only the best professor here on campus, but one of the best people in Madison. Funny, inspirational, and very clear: he makes the ideal professor for any subject. I learned a TON about insects in this class all due to his amazing style. Everything is graded easily: it is impossible not to get a AB.  Ann is pretty hot ;)

Professor Hogg is such a wonderful professor. He genuinely loves the course that he teaches and cares about each and every one of his students. His material is not difficult to learn, and he makes every lecture very interesting and fun. I wish there were more professors out there like him. Keep it up Dr. Hogg!

Professor Hogg is too cool! He is hilarious and incredibly passionate about insects.  All you have to do in order to do well in the class is review his powerpoints, which he posts online. That being said, I would still go to lecture seeing as it is a great time!
Worth the time, everything on the tests is given in class and extra credit offered on everything

Perfect class for anyone looking for a Biological Sciences credit.  One paper that you can submit early and correct.  13 quizzes and three are thrown out.  Usually curves his exams which are easy to begin with.

Prof. Hogg is as good as college professors get. He is very sincere both personally, as well as in the way he presents course content. It is obvious that he enjoys Entomology and wants his students to feel the same way. He is very approachable and an all around great guy; not to mention that he teaches an easy course.

OMG,the best professor ever AT UW-Madison. He is so kind, caring and good-looking! You will get an A if you work hard. Im a biochem major and so this is the easist science i have ever taken. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Professor Hogg was so great. He loves teaching. I think he amped the course up a little bit in terms of difficulty but getting an A is still very manageable. Highly recommend this course as a Biological Science credit for non-science majors.

Such a great guy. He will do everything he can to help you out. Super friendly and makes the subject interesting. Attendance is necessary because there are quizzes and minute assesments. He wants you to enjoy the class!
Great professor! Loves teaching about this subject. Also the class is super easy. No doubt you will get an A. One of the nicest and most genuine teachers
He is very nice and you can tell he really loves to teach. I found the class helpful in everyday's life. The best part is I got to keep an insects, although I have to re-do it for four times.

Easiest science credits at UW Madison. Class is extremely simple. No exams whatsoever, quizzes every week and as long as you go over the notes for like 15 minutes you will ace all of them. Prof Hogg doesn't take the class very seriously and seems to enjoy teaching students about insects. If you can't get an A in this class then college isnt for you

You can tell he really love insects. I found the attendance quizzes are very helpful to raise my understanding about insects. One of the best and passionate professor I had so far. He is very nice, and lectures are interesting with current issues. Take this class and do go to his classes!

This class is great. Reminds me of a middle or elementary level, with a party on the last day and everything. Easy A if you do the essays and show up for attendance quizzes. Really nice guy, but don't expect to learn a lot. If you need a science credit, take this. If you want to learn something, I wouldn't recommend it. Also you have to raise a bug

He is the best professor you would want to have. Very helpful and memorizes students' names. You can rewrite essays if you are not satisfied with your scores and drop as much as 3 quizzes! Take professor Hogg and you definitely ace Entom 201 class!

Prof Hogg is a really nice guy. He remembers students' names and expresses his enthusiasm about insects (especially bed bugs, honey bees & aphids), making the lectures interesting. The course is easy. Weekly attendance quizzes (easy + bonus questions), write 6 essays, rear bugs (manduca), no test/exam. Minimum 95 for an A (very possible).

Easiest class at Madison. Take a quiz once a week, write 6 essays, you get an A. I even killed my bug and I still got an A. Plus he is an awesome guy who cares about his students (he memorizes everyone's name even the ones that never go to class)

A GREAT professor, super helpful and really clear about expectations. There are weekly quizzes, but they're easily aced with a few minutes of review. He offers extra credit on each quiz as well. You have to write 2 papers, but you can turn them in early so he'll give you a preliminary grade so you have the chance to fix a crappy paper.

Easiest class ever. No midterms or final, but weekly attendance quizzes (which you will ace if you pay attention) and essays (which you can rewrite to boost your score). Also, 20% of grade is raising an insect. 85% is an AB, but with extra credit questions on each quiz, you can easily get an A (95%+). And he's a funny guy. Definitely take it!
